title: Todd Greenberg
text:
Todd Greenberg (born 2 July 1971) is an Australian <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> administrator who was Chief Executive Officer of the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a> between March 2016 and April 2020.
Background.
Greenberg was born in 1971 in <a href="Sydney">Sydney</a>, <a href="New%20South%20Wales">New South Wales</a>, Australia. He is <a href="Jews">Jewish</a>. He went to high school at <a href="Sydney%20Technical%20High%20School">Sydney Tech</a>. His grandfather, Dr Les Greenberg, was the first medical officer to the <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Rugby%20League">New South Wales Rugby League</a>.
Career.
Greenberg represented Australia in cricket at two editions of the <a href="Maccabiah%20Games">Maccabiah Games</a>, an international multi-sport event for Jewish athletes.
Greenberg completed a sports science degree at the <a href="University%20of%20New%20South%20Wales">University of New South Wales</a> and a part-time master's degree at <a href="University%20of%20Technology%20Sydney">University of Technology Sydney</a>.
Between 1993 and 1998 Greenberg worked for <a href="Cricket%20NSW">Cricket NSW</a> as Events & Promotions Manager. Greenberg joined the NRL club <a href="Canterbury-Bankstown%20Bulldogs">Canterbury-Bankstown Bulldogs</a> in 2001 as Operations and Events Manager. He then left in 2001 to become the General Manager of <a href="Stadium%20Australia">Stadium Australia</a>. In 2008 he returned to Canterbury-Bankstown, taking on the position CEO, a role he held with the <a href="Belmore%20Sports%20Ground">Belmore</a> club until 2013; when he was appointed the Head of Football for the NRL.
In March 2016 Greenberg was appointed Chief Executive Officer of the NRL, succeeding <a href="David%20Smith%20%28executive%29">David Smith</a>. Greenberg stepped down as CEO on April 20, 2020.
